name: Industrial Dreams and Digital Realities: Self Reliance in Bengaluru
description:
How has the desire for self-reliance evolved in Bengaluru?
In recent years, slogans to ‘Make in India’, harnessing a desire to become Self Reliant or Atmanirbhar Bharat have become ubiquitous. As ambitious as they are, they are not new. The early years of newly decolonized India, much like many other nascent nations across Asia and Africa, embraced self-reliance as a way of achieving economic and political independence from imperial powers.
A number of these technological and industrial projects were located in the city of Bengaluru, making it a true city of Science and Technology. At different points these projects enrolled key actors, from the model citizen-worker to the ‘tech entrepreneur’. Join Aditi Dey as she traces these episodes of Bengaluru’s history and the emergence of the celebrated figure of the ‘tech entrepreneur’. Diving into the history of technopolitics in Bengaluru.

name: Bird Walk At Harohalli Kere
description:
Come and hang out with some of Bengaluru's feathered citizens!
Join us for a birdwalk around Harohalli Kere led by Ashwin Viswanathan. Spend the morning spotting and learning about the many birds that call our city and its lakes home. Learn to identify these birds by sight and sound. Open to everyone from beginners to experienced birdwatchers.

name: From Cantonment to Capital: Antics in Namma Bengaluru
description:
Did you know that 2 feet were added to the calculation of Mount Everest's height just to make it look “credible”? Or that shock therapy was used to “cure hysteria”?

Bengaluru has a rich history of discoveries and inventions. But within these, there are also interesting shenanigans full of flounder and whimsy. From educational institutes to government bodies, strange and surreal stories surround us!

In this walkthrough of our current exhibition-season Sci560, take a trip down shenanigan lane with our mediators Ghreeshma and Adithya.
